abstract.p: Three men described by investigators as members of Fujianese gang are charged with November 1996 kidnapping of 12-year-old Wei Yang, who resides in Meriden, Conn; boy was held for six days and released unharmed in Queens, NY, after his father paid ransom of $88,000; two of suspects are identified as Zheng Wei Sheng and Zheng Xian Chao (S)

block.p: Three men described by investigators as members of a Fujianese gang were charged in Federal District Court in Manhattan on Friday with the November kidnapping of a 12-year-old Connecticut boy, Federal law-enforcement officials said. The boy was held for six days and released unharmed in Queens after his father paid a ransom of $88,000.

After his release, the boy, Wei Yang, identified his kidnappers from photographs of known Asian gang members, said Merrill Parks Jr., the special agent in charge of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in Connecticut. Investigators also recovered a wallet belonging to a suspect from a light blue minivan used to pick up the ransom on a patch of grass where the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway and the Long Island Expressway intersect.

The boy was held for six days and released unharmed in Queens after his father paid a ransom of $88,000.

After his release, the boy, Wei Yang, identified his kidnappers from photographs of known Asian gang members, said Merrill Parks Jr., the special agent in charge of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in Connecticut. Investigators also recovered a wallet belonging to a suspect from a light blue minivan used to pick up the ransom on a patch of grass where the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway and the Long Island Expressway intersect.

One suspect, identified as Zheng Wei Sheng, was arrested on Thursday night at a restaurant on Elizabeth Street in Chinatown. Two others were arrested Friday in Queens. One of those men was identified by investigators as Zheng Xian Chao. Investigators said they could not confirm the third suspect's identity.
The boy, whose family came to the United States from the Fujian province of China, was taken from his home in Meriden, Conn., on the evening of Nov. 28.
